questions.text: Let's do a quick and simple test of your understanding of this study.

questions.prompt: What is the purpose of this study?
textChoices: Understand the fluctuations of Parkinson disease symptoms

questions.prompt: My name will be stored with my study data.
I can choose to share my coded study data sparsely or more broadly.
I will be able to skip any survey question.
I will be able to stop participating at any time.

quiz.failureMessage: Unfortunately you answered one or more questions incorrectly. You can return to the beginning of the walkthrough to get more information about the study.
quiz.successMessage:
You answered all of the questions correctly. 
Tap Next to continue.

sections.sectionSummary: This simple walkthrough will explain the research study, the impact it may have on your life and will allow you to provide your consent to participate.
Before completing the enrollment it is important to understand what the study is about and what is involved.
To better understand your evolving health, we will ask you to perform simple activities and respond to surveys.
With your permission this study will also gather sensor data from your iPhone and personal devices.
Your study data (survey, activities and sensors) will be combined with similar data from other participants.

We will replace your name with a random code on all your study data. This code cannot be used to re-identify you. To prevent improper access, the coded data will be encrypted and stored on a secure Cloud server under the control of Sage Bionetworks (nonprofit).
Your coded data will be used for research. It will be transferred to an analysis platform in the United States and, with your permission, it may be shared with qualified researchers worldwide.
This study will take about 20 minutes per day.
We will ask you to answer brief weekly and monthly surveys about your symptoms to track any changes.
We will also ask you to perform simple activities, like walking a few steps while holding or using your iPhone.
Your participation is voluntary. You may withdraw your consent and discontinue participation at any time.

Your participation could help people understand and manage PD symptoms better.  On a personal level, you will be able to visualize your own data and potentially learn more about trends in your health.
This research is not a treatment study. You do not need to respond to questions that make you feel uncomfortable.
Participating in this study could generate a wide range of emotions.

Your coded data, including health information and location data may be transfered to countries that may have different data protection laws than your country of residence.  We will make every effort to protect your information, but total anonymity cannot be guaranteed.
